history.proof: intros Hprime x Hx. apply (Zp_mult_invert x). shelve.

exceptions.tactic: intros p Hp Hprime x Hx.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}

Premises:
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Z_Zp = {x : nat | x < p} : Set
Notation Op := Zp_one
Notation Zp := Zp_zero
Zp_mult_invert : forall x, is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1 -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
Zp_invertible = fun x => exists i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op : Z_Zp -> Prop
Zp_mult_revert : forall x i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
no_common_prime_is_coprime : forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> divides p x -> divides p y -> False) -> is_gcd x y 1
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
Zp_mult_one_r : forall x, x ⊗ Op = x
Zp_mult_one : forall x, Op ⊗ x = x
prime_decomp : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> {l : list nat | n = fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l /\ Forall prime l}
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
prime_div_mult : forall p x y : nat, prime p -> divides p (x * y) -> divides p x \/ divides p y
Zp_mult_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊗ z) = x ⊗ y ⊗ z
Zp_mult_comm : forall x y, x ⊗ y = y ⊗ x

Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
divides_le : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> divides p q -> p <= q
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m

div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
Zp_invertible_spec : forall x, Zp_invertible x < -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1

prime_in_decomp : forall (p : nat) (l : list nat), prime p -> Forall prime l -> divides p (fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l) -> In p l

euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}

division_by_even : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {j : nat | arem n d q j}}
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ divides p n}

prime_decomp_uniq : forall l m : list nat, Forall prime l -> Forall prime m -> fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l = fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 m -> l ~p m
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, divides x y -> divides y z -> divides x z
Zdiv_eucl_extended : forall b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> forall a : Z, {qr : Z * Z | let (q, r) := qr in a = (b * q + r)%Z /\ (0 <= r < Z.abs b)%Z}
prime_gcd : forall p q : nat, prime p -> is_gcd p q 1 \/ divides p q
